avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche danger increases to moderate above the tree line. Fresh snowdrift accumulations, mainly in the north, east and south sectors, can be triggered as medium slab avalanches in some places behind ridgelines, terrain edges and in gullies and bowls due to low additional loads.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Increase in avalanche danger due to fresh wind slab!

snowpackStructure.comment: Up to 20 cm of new fallen snow, sometimes interspersed with graupel, is being transported to the eastern sectors by strong westerly winds, especially in the northern Alps, where it forms bound wind slab. In regions and terrain with little wind, the new fallen snow remains soft and powdery. The fresh wind slab is often covered by a weak layer of faceted crystals or surface hoar. In the foundation of the snow cover, kinetic metamorphism (floating snow) weakens the stability.

tendency.highlights:
The weather will calm down briefly on Saturday morning before snowfall starts again with the influx of cold polar air.
The risk of avalanches increases slightly.

weatherForecast.comment:
Snowfall will intensify in the western northern Alps during the night to Friday. During the day, deep wintry weather will prevail and the snowfall will move across the Niedere Tauern and into the foothills during the morning. After the weather calms down briefly, the snowfall could intensify again in western Upper Styria in the evening. A total of up to 20 cm of new fallen snow is expected.
The wind will be strong in the northern Alps and somewhat weaker from the west south of the main Alpine ridge. Temperatures at 2000 metres will be much milder than recently at -4 to 0 degrees.

avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche danger is low. However, fresh snowdrift accumulations in gullies and bowls that have been blown in as well as behind ridges and ridgelines above the tree line are prone to disruption and can be triggered by a single person as a small slab avalanche.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Low avalanche danger, but watch out for fresh wind slab!

snowpackStructure.comment: Fresh snowdrift accumulations often lie on faceted crystals or surface hoar, which can act as a weak layer. Apart from this, the old snow surface is only covered by a few centimetres of new fallen snow. In general, kinetic metamorphism weakens the thin snow base, fundament. Windward terrain is usually blown off and almost snow-free.

tendency.highlights:
The weather will calm down briefly on Saturday morning before moderate snowfall sets in again with an influx of cold polar air.
The risk of avalanches increases slightly.

weatherForecast.comment: Light snowfall will begin in the Mürzsteg Alps in the night to Friday, which may intensify briefly in the morning. However, less than 10 cm of new fallen snow is expected in total. The highest peaks will be covered in clouds and visibility will be limited. The wind is blowing strongly from the west to north-west. The temperature at 2000 metres will be significantly milder than recently at around -2 degrees.

ALBINA.generalHeadline: New fallen snow and wind increase the avalanche danger above the tree line!
